territory.notes: Under a charter from Britain (granted in the wake of the 1885 Treaty of Berlin), the Royal Niger Company was granted a concession in 1886 to territory and trade in south-central Nigeria, in an area centered on Lukoja and the upper Niger River. The Royal Niger Company attempted to bring the Kingdom of Ilorin (a vassal state under the Fulani Empire) under British control in 1897, but was apparently unsuccessful in doing so. On January 1, 1900, the Royal Niger Companyâ€™s charter was terminated and its territorial claims turned over to the new Protectorates of Northern and Southern Nigeria, in return for the retention of certain mineral rights.
